definition[0]: wise decisions and actions are sensible and based on good judgment
example[1]: I don’t think that would be a very wise move (=not be a sensible thing to do).
example[2]: It’s wise to check whether the flight times have changed before you leave for the airport.
note[0]: it is wise to do something
example[3]: I think you were wise to leave when you did.
definition[1]: someone who is wise makes good decisions, gives good advice etc, especially because they have a lot of experience of life
example[5]: At the time I thought he was wonderful, but I’m older and wiser now.
example[6]: As a manager, Sanford was wise in the ways of (=knew a lot about) company politics.
